channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Portable toilet left after recent resurfacing work. Begining to smell. Health hazard, 17th October
item.description:
Marleyfield Way, Churchdown GL3 1JW.Top our cul-de-sac. Resurfacing was done on Monday. Portable loo still there on Friday and starting to smell, Please remove urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marleyfield Way, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping in Gardners Lane near School and the Folley plus bushes need trimming back Shelter, 17th October
item.description:
Flytipping happened about two weeks ago The bushes overhand the road and need to be clipped back to improve visability especially on the corner by Midwinter allotment entrance
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gardners Lane, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light is permanently out problem, 17th October
item.description:
SL not working at the location, plus it is obscured by trees when working and emits very little light as a consequence.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken road surface, 17th October
item.description:
Recent repairs have failed to address and resolve the safety issues on this roundabout. The road surface is in a very poor state with broken tarmac and differing levels of the road surface. This is very dangerous for cyclists and creates trip hazards for those on foot. This roundabout requires urgent work to make it safe to use, really frustrating that when Fairview Rd was resufaced the opportunity to repair the roundabout wasn't taken. The very recent repairs failed to address the issues and are failing already. Do we need a serious or fatal accident before action is taken?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, All Saints' Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No street lighting in Langdon Road and part of Fairfield Parade, 17th October
item.description:
The street lighting has been out for 4 days. It may be just a coincidence that BT Openreach have just dug up the pavement in Langdon Road to unstall WiFi to 252 Bath Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Langdon Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Missing sign (Parking) problem, 17th October
item.description:
Drivers are parking over the VDK on the junc of Hesters Way Road and Listening Post Close making it impossible to use with a mobility scooter. Can the parking be looked at? Or bollards put there big enough for a mobility scooter to get through but stop a car parking there?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The 98 bus stop at Chargrove Lane is very dangerous, there is no pavement to step onto, just a narrow verge of brambles, mud and nettles. Somebody will slip and fall under the bus, 17th October
item.description:
The location is just past the entrance to Chargrove Lane on the way to Gloucester. I am pleased to have this new bus service, but it is extremly dangerous for anyone who is unsteady on their feet who might hold on to the side of the bus to steady themselves. Urgent attention is needed before a serious accident happens
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley Way, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
